required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Preliminary Tolerability of Lyophilized Lucinactant in Adults With Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single-Treatment Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of Lyophilized Lucinactant in Adults With COVID-19 Associated Acute Lung Injury

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, single-treatment study. Subjects will consist of adults with COVID-19 associated acute lung injury who are being cared for in a critical care environment.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicenter, single-treatment study. Subjects will consist of adults with COVID-19 associated acute lung injury who are being cared for in a critical care environment.
Lucinactant is a synthetic surfactant that, in its liquid form (SURFAXIN®), is approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration (NDA 021746) for the prevention of respiratory distress syndrome (RDS) in premature infants at high risk for RDS.
It has been studied in over 2000 children and adults. Preliminary data from animal and adult human studies indicate that lucinactant may be able to benefit those with acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) in the context of COVID-19 infection, improving oxygenation and lung compliance. When given to intubated patients, Lucinactant could potentially decrease the duration of ventilation.
Lucinactant has an extensive safety profile in different patient populations for different indications.
It is hypothesized that lucinactant may improve the respiratory status of patients suffering from COVID-19.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open-label, single treatment of reconstituted Lucinactant, delivered as an intratracheal liquid.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety and feasibility of Lucinactant surfactant replacement therapy (SRT) in treating COVID-19
primary_outcome.time_frame: (OI) through 12 hours post dosing and other physiological and outcome measurements through 24 hours or through Day 30
primary_outcome.description: The oxygen index (OI), where OI is defined as (Mean Airway Pressure [Paw]) x (Fraction of Inspired Oxygen [FiO2]) x (100) / (Partial Pressure of Oxygen [PaO2]), and other physiological and outcome measurements

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 12 hours post initiation of dosing
primary_outcome.description: Change in OI, where OI is defined as (Mean Airway Pressure [Paw]) x (Fraction of Inspired Oxygen [FiO2]) x (100) / (Partial Pressure of Oxygen [PaO2])

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in FiO2 measured using mean, standard deviation (SD), median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in PaO2 measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in SpO2 measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in OI, defined as (Mean Airway Pressure [Paw]) x (Fraction of Inspired Oxygen [FiO2]) x (100)/(Partial Pressure of Oxygen [PaO2]) measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in PaCO2 measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ETCO2 measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of arterial oxygen concentration to fraction of inspired oxygen and/or ratio of pulse oximetric saturation to fraction of inspired oxygen (P/F and/or S/F ratios)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in P/F and/or S/F ratios measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.measure: Plateau pressure and peak inspiratory pressure (PPLAT and PIP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in PPLAT and PIP, as measured on the ventilator, measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in VI, defined as (Respiration Rate [RR]) × (Peak Inspiratory Pressure [PIP] - Positive End Expiratory Pressure [PEEP]) × (Partial Pressure of Arterial Carbon Dioxide (PaCO2)] / (1000) measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lung compliance measured using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.measure: Pressure-volume loops, if ventilator technology permits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 24 hours post initiation of dosing
Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in daily lung compliance (static) on ventilator using mean, standard deviation (SD), median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ventilator free days using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.measure: Days in the intensive care unit (ICU)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in days in the intensive care unit (ICU) using mean, standard deviation (SD), median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in days in the hospital using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through 30 days post initiation of dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Organ failure free days using mean, SD, median, minimum, and maximum

clinical_study.condition: Acute Lung Injury/Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)

arm_group.description: Lyophilized Lucinactant reconstituted with sterile water for injection

intervention.description: Lucinactant administered as a liquid at a dose of 80 mg total phospholipids (TPL)/kg lean body weight delivered

facility.name: University of California - Jacobs Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: The preparation and submittal for publication of a manuscript containing the study results shall be in accordance with a process determined by a mutual written agreement among Windtree and participating institutions. The publication or presentation of any study results shall comply with all applicable privacy laws, including but not limited to HIPAA. This trial will be registered at ClinicalTrials.gov, and results information from this trial will be submitted. In addition, every attempt will be made to publish results in peer-reviewed journals.
